intro: Erythroxylum distortum, commonly known as the twisted copal, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, twisted stems and small, pale green leaves. It produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing seeds. Due to its unique morphology, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
